item.title: 投资者最后一次真正为科技基础设施感到兴奋
item.description:
还记得电信泡沫吗？【原文：

Remember the Telecom Bubble?

】

item.title: 奇货可居：科技投资者最后一次如此兴奋（播客）
item.description: 目前，笼罩在市场上空的最大问题之一是，对更多人工智能数据中心支出的看似无限的需求是否正在放缓。在过去几年里，这类科技基础设施一直是行业的大赢家。当然，这并不是投资者第一次对这类交易感到兴奋。20 世纪 90 年代末和 21 世纪初的 "科技泡沫 "或 "网络泡沫 "常常被人们铭记在心，但有一个特殊的方面是，当时的投资者并没有意识到这一点。【原文：One of the biggest questions hanging over the market right now is whether or not the seemingly unlimited appetite for more AI data center spending is slowing down or not. This type of tech infrastructure has been a massive sectoral winner over the last few years. But of course, this isn’t the first time investors have gotten excited about this type of trade. The late 1990s and early 2000s are often remembered as being the time of a “tech bubble” or “dot-com bubble,” but one specific aspect was t】

item.title: 法国和西班牙通胀下行，支持欧洲央行降息
item.description: 法国和西班牙的通胀低于预期，支持了欧洲中央银行进一步降息的呼声。【原文：Inflation in France and Spain undershot expectations, supporting calls for more interest-rate cuts by the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 印度热浪推动空调销售，不惧消费放缓
item.description: 印度的空调制造商预计，由于历史性的高温天气以及预计未来将出现的更多高温天气，制冷系统的需求将大增，因此将迎来销售热潮。【原文：India’s air conditioner makers are expecting a sales boom as historic heat, and forecasts of more hot weather to come, boosts demand for cooling systems.】

item.title: 英国家庭储蓄增加，对前景的担忧加剧
item.description: 英国人将可支配收入中的很大一部分存起来，这是一个历史性的迹象，表明在国内经济疲软和全球动荡的背景下，消费者不愿消费。【原文：Britons are saving an historically large portion their disposable income, a sign that consumers are reluctant to spend in the face of a weak domestic economy and a turbulent global backdrop.】

item.title: 土耳其被监禁市长批评西方 "沉默
item.description: 土耳其反对派人士埃克雷姆-伊马莫格鲁（Ekrem Imamoglu）本月被拘留，引发了大规模抗议活动和市场大跌。【原文：Ekrem Imamoglu, the Turkish opposition figure whose detention this month triggered mass protests and a market selloff, criticized Western leaders for their muted response to his arrest.】

item.title: 英国零售销售额连续两个月意外增长
item.description: 英国 2 月份零售销售额连续第二个月增长，表明消费者信心正在恢复，财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）对此感到意外。【原文：UK retail sales increased for a second month in February, suggesting consumer confidence is returning in a surprise boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.】

item.title: EQT 为其最新基础设施基金融资 215 亿欧元
item.description: EQT AB 为其最新的基础设施基金筹集了 215 亿欧元（约合 232 亿美元）的资金；这家瑞典投资公司的一位高管称，这一数额凸显了能源行业的资金需求如何战胜了不确定的交易市场。【原文：EQT AB has raised €21.5 billion ($23.2 billion) for its latest infrastructure fund — a sum a top executive for the Swedish investment firm says underscores how the energy sector’s funding needs trump an uncertain market for deals.】

item.title: 莱维镇深陷造假案检察官发问："这是什么罪？
item.description:
在数十名列维特镇妇女在骚扰网站上发现自己的虚假图片数月后，警方逮捕了一名嫌疑人，检察官也已上岗。【原文：

Months after dozens of Levittown women discovered faked images of themselves on a harassment site, police make an arrest — and prosecutors are on the clock.

】

item.title: 英国 "更雄心勃勃 "的债务办公室为里夫斯提供了一些喘息机会
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）可能要感谢她的债务办公室，该办公室降低借贷成本的做法受到了分析师们的称赞。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves likely owes some gratitude to her debt office, which was lauded by analysts for its approach to lowering borrowing costs.】

item.title: 法国兴业银行聘请马克龙的高级顾问主管投资银行业务
item.description: 法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）任命亚历克西斯-科勒（Alexis Kohler）为其投资银行董事长，由法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）的长期高级顾问来监管其主要业务之一。【原文：Societe Generale SA named Alexis Kohler chairman of its investment bank, tapping French President Emmanuel Macron’s longstanding top adviser to oversee one of its key businesses.】

item.title: 中国收紧氧化铝扩产规定以解决产能过剩问题
item.description: 中国收紧了新建氧化铝厂的规定，以解决导致世界顶级金属市场价格暴跌的产能过剩问题。【原文：China tightened rules on building new alumina plants, in a bid to tackle overcapacity that has caused a plunge in prices in the world’s top metals market.】

item.title: 南非顶级银行 Capitec 的 Lee 将接替 Fourie 担任首席执行官
item.description: 南非客户数量最多的贷款银行 Capitec 银行控股有限公司任命 Graham Lee 为首席执行官，因为 Gerrie Fourie 计划退休。【原文：Capitec Bank Holdings Ltd., South Africa’s lender bank by number of customers, named Graham Lee its chief executive officer as Gerrie Fourie plans to retire.】

item.title: 在美国提出要求后，印度考虑降低农产品关税
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，印度正在审查美国提出的削减农产品进口关税和大幅减少其他壁垒的要求，因为新德里官员正竭力要求免除唐纳德-特朗普总统下周提出的对等关税。【原文：India is reviewing US demands it cut import duties on farm goods and significantly reduce other barriers, people familiar with the matter said, as officials in New Delhi press for an exemption from President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs next week.】

item.title: 莱维镇》E4："这怎么不违法"（播客）
item.description: 在莱维镇的一次逮捕拉开了下一阶段调查的序幕。检察官的核心问题是：这算不算犯罪？他们正在抓紧时间【原文：An arrest in Levittown kicks off the next phase of an investigation. The central question for the prosecutors is: Is any of this a crime? And they’re on the clock.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 2 月零售销售意外增长
印度因文件失效禁止油轮运输俄罗斯原油
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，一艘为国营印度石油公司运送俄罗斯原油的油轮因缺乏适当文件而被拒绝进入这个亚洲重要买家的港口。【原文：A tanker carrying Russian crude for state-run Indian Oil Corp. has been denied entry to a port in the key Asian buyer due to a lack of proper documentation, according to people familiar with the development.】

item.title: 您的下一辆二手车将被征收关税
item.description:
解放日当天，市场可能已经平静下来，但消费者已经觉醒。【原文：

Markets may have calmed about Liberation Day, but consumers are already waking up.

】

item.title: 贷款人面临英国大学 95 亿英镑债务负担的风险
item.description:
在学生人数未能如预期般快速增长后，破产风险正在上升

。【原文：

Risk of an insolvency is rising after student numbers failed to grow as fast as expected

】

item.title: 斯洛伐克总理试图取代欧洲央行卡齐米尔的努力失败了
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员彼得-卡齐米尔可能会留任一段时间，尽管他的祖国斯洛伐克正在努力取而代之。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Peter Kazimir may retain his post for some time, despite efforts in his homeland of Slovakia to replace him.】

item.title: 特朗普敲打美元，马克龙评估欧元开局
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普激起了欧洲领导人对货币市场的兴趣。【原文：Donald Trump has piqued European leaders’ interest in currency markets.】

item.title: 加纳新任央行行长将通过保持利率来显示实力
item.description: 加纳新任央行行长将维持基准利率不变，以显示其对抗顽固高通胀的决心。【原文：Ghana’s new central bank governor is set to show his resolve in fighting stubbornly high inflation by keeping the benchmark interest rate unchanged.】

item.title: 毛里求斯计划采取激励措施吸引富人，促进经济增长
item.description: 毛里求斯正计划采取激励措施吸引富有的投资者，并将更多外国资本引入其金融服务部门，以促进经济增长和稳定公共财政。【原文：Mauritius is planning incentives to attract wealthy investors and channel more foreign capital into its financial-services sector to bolster economic growth and stabilize public finances.】

item.title: 英国关键住房目标受制于谨慎的住宅建筑商
item.description: 英国政府已将促进住宅建设作为其增长计划的核心目标。而实际交付这些住宅的公司已经告诉股东们，他们无法实现这一目标。【原文：The UK government has put a target to boost homebuilding at the center of its growth plans. The companies that will actually deliver those homes are already telling shareholders they won’t get close to achieving it.】

item.title: 特朗普掀起下一波关税浪潮，保时捷无处藏身
item.description: 自 20 世纪 30 年代以来，斯图加特的祖文豪森区一直是保时捷公司的核心所在，这家跑车制造商绝大多数产品仍由德国制造，这使其有可能成为唐纳德-特朗普贸易战中的最大输家。【原文：The Zuffenhausen district of Stuttgart has been the heart of Porsche AG since the 1930s, and the sports car maker remains overwhelmingly Made in Germany, making it potentially the biggest loser in Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 台湾调查中国芯片制造商中芯国际涉嫌挖走员工
item.description: 台湾正在调查中国领先的芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp.【原文：Taiwan is investigating whether China’s leading chipmaker Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. illegally poached local engineers as part of an effort to access the island’s cutting-edge chip technology.】

item.title: 印度 BSE 指数因竞争对手推迟更改到期日而反弹
item.description: 印度历史最悠久的证券交易所 BSE Ltd. 的股价创下自 12 月以来的最大涨幅，因为其竞争对手交易所推迟了一项被认为有可能增加其市场份额的计划。【原文：India’s oldest stock exchange BSE Ltd. saw its shares surge the most since December, after its rival bourse deferred a plan that was seen potentially increasing its market share.】

item.title: 寻求对冲，灵活应对：宏观交易员为关税日制定计划
item.description: 从纽约到伦敦和香港，投资者在下周宣布关税之前都在削减风险，同时保留现金，以备在机会出现时立即出手。【原文：From New York to London and Hong Kong, investors are cutting back risk ahead of next week’s tariff announcements, while keeping cash ready to pounce the moment opportunities arise.】

item.title: 澳元实际收益率飙升 对抗高昂生活成本
item.description: 澳大利亚政府宣布计划在大选年加大发债力度，以减轻选民的生活费用压力，因此澳大利亚经通胀调整后的债券收益率跃升至十多年来的最高点。【原文：Australia’s inflation-adjusted bond yields jumped to the highest in over a decade as the government announced plans to ramp up debt issuance in an election year to alleviate cost-of-living pressure on voters.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Dymon 聘请前新加坡交易所高管
item.description: 戴蒙亚洲资本（Dymon Asia Capital）聘请了新加坡交易所（Singapore Exchange Ltd.）批发市场和平台部前主管 Lee Beng Hong，负责监管其财务、交易和技术职能。【原文：Dymon Asia Capital has hired Lee Beng Hong, the former head of wholesale markets and platforms at Singapore Exchange Ltd. to oversee its treasury, trading and technology functions.】
